content:
Play: All's Well That Ends Well
Category: comedy
Year: 1604-1605
Setting: France and Italy

Main Characters:
- Helena
- Bertram
- Countess of Roussillon
- King of France
- Parolles
- Diana

Character Descriptions:
- Helena: Physician's daughter, loves Bertram, heals king
- Bertram: Nobleman, reluctant husband of Helena
- Countess of Roussillon: Bertram's mother, supports Helena
- King of France: Ruler, healed by Helena, grants marriage
- Parolles: Bertram's boastful, disloyal companion
- Diana: Young woman, aids Helena's plan

Play: Antony and Cleopatra
Category: tragedy
Year: 1606
Setting: Rome and Egypt

Main Characters:
- Mark Antony
- Cleopatra
- Octavius Caesar
- Enobarbus
- Charmian

Character Descriptions:
- Mark Antony: Roman general, lover of Cleopatra
- Cleopatra: Queen of Egypt, Antony's lover
- Octavius Caesar: Roman leader, Antony's rival
- Enobarbus: Antony's loyal officer, defects later
- Charmian: Cleopatra's devoted attendant

Play: As You Like It
Category: comedy
Year: 1599-1600
Setting: Court and Forest of Arden

Main Characters:
- Rosalind
- Orlando
- Celia
- Duke Senior
- Duke Frederick
- Jaques
- Touchstone
- Oliver
- Silvius
- Phebe

Character Descriptions:
- Rosalind: Duke Senior's daughter, disguises as Ganymede
- Orlando: Young noble, loves Rosalind
- Celia: Duke Frederick's daughter, Rosalind's cousin
- Duke Senior: Exiled duke, lives in Arden
- Duke Frederick: Usurping duke, banishes Rosalind
- Jaques: Melancholy lord, follows Duke Senior
- Touchstone: Court fool, joins Rosalind's exile
- Oliver: Orlando's brother, initially hostile
- Silvius: Shepherd, loves Phebe
- Phebe: Shepherdess, loves Ganymede

Play: The Comedy of Errors
Category: comedy
Year: 1594
Setting: Ephesus

Main Characters:
- Antipholus of Syracuse
- Antipholus of Ephesus
- Dromio of Syracuse
- Dromio of Ephesus
- Adriana
- Luciana

Character Descriptions:
- Antipholus of Syracuse: Twin merchant, searches for brother
- Antipholus of Ephesus: Twin merchant, resident of Ephesus
- Dromio of Syracuse: Servant to Antipholus of Syracuse
- Dromio of Ephesus: Servant to Antipholus of Ephesus
- Adriana: Wife of Antipholus of Ephesus
- Luciana: Adriana's sister, courted by Syracuse twin

Play: The Tragedy of Coriolanus
Category: tragedy
Year: 1608-1609
Setting: Rome and its surrounding territories

Main Characters:
- Caius Martius Coriolanus
- Volumnia
- Menenius Agrippa
- Tullus Aufidius
- Sicinius Velutus
- Junius Brutus
- Virgilia
- Young Martius

Character Descriptions:
- Caius Martius Coriolanus: Roman general, banished, seeks revenge
- Volumnia: Coriolanus's mother, influences his actions
- Menenius Agrippa: Roman patrician, Coriolanus's ally
- Tullus Aufidius: Volscian general, allies with Coriolanus
- Sicinius Velutus: Tribune, opposes Coriolanus
- Junius Brutus: Tribune, seeks Coriolanus's banishment
- Virgilia: Coriolanus's wife, loyal supporter
- Young Martius: Coriolanus's son, minor role

Play: Cymbeline
Category: tragedy
Year: 1609-1610
Setting: Ancient Britain and Rome

Main Characters:
- Cymbeline
- Imogen
- Posthumus Leonatus
- Iachimo
- Cloten
- Queen
- Belarius
- Guiderius
- Arviragus

Character Descriptions:
- Cymbeline: King of Britain, Imogen's father
- Imogen: Cymbeline's daughter, loves Posthumus
- Posthumus Leonatus: Imogen's husband, exiled noble
- Iachimo: Italian noble, deceives Posthumus
- Cloten: Queen's son, seeks Imogen
- Queen: Cymbeline's wife, Imogen's stepmother
- Belarius: Exiled lord, raises king's sons
- Guiderius: Cymbeline's son, raised by Belarius
- Arviragus: Cymbeline's son, raised by Belarius

Play: Hamlet, Prince of Denmark
Category: tragedy
Year: 1600-1601
Setting: Elsinore Castle, Denmark

Main Characters:
- Hamlet
- Claudius
- Gertrude
- Ophelia
- Polonius
- Horatio
- Laertes
- Ghost of Hamlet's father

Character Descriptions:
- Hamlet: Prince of Denmark, seeks revenge
- Claudius: King of Denmark, Hamlet's uncle, murderer
- Gertrude: Queen of Denmark, Hamlet's mother
- Ophelia: Polonius's daughter, Hamlet's love interest
- Polonius: King's advisor, Ophelia's father
- Horatio: Hamlet's loyal friend and confidant
- Laertes: Polonius's son, seeks vengeance
- Ghost of Hamlet's father: Spirit, urges Hamlet to avenge murder

play_title: King Henry IV, the First Part
content:
Play: King Henry IV, the First Part
Category: history
Year: 1596-1597
Setting: England, early 15th century

Main Characters:
- King Henry IV
- Prince Hal
- Sir John Falstaff
- Hotspur (Henry Percy)
- Earl of Worcester
- Earl of Northumberland
- Lady Percy

Character Descriptions:
- King Henry IV: King of England, faces rebellion
- Prince Hal: Heir to throne, proves worth
- Sir John Falstaff: Prince Hal's roguish companion
- Hotspur (Henry Percy): Rebel leader, Percy family heir
- Earl of Worcester: Rebel noble, Hotspur's uncle
- Earl of Northumberland: Hotspur's father, supports rebellion
- Lady Percy: Hotspur's wife, supports husband

play_title: King Henry IV, the Second Part
content:
Play: King Henry IV, the Second Part
Category: history
Year: 1597-1598
Setting: England, early 15th century

Main Characters:
- King Henry IV
- Prince Hal
- Sir John Falstaff
- Lord Chief Justice
- Archbishop of York
- Earl of Northumberland
- Prince John

Character Descriptions:
- King Henry IV: King of England, nearing death
- Prince Hal: Heir, becomes King Henry V
- Sir John Falstaff: Prince Hal's companion, later rejected
- Lord Chief Justice: Legal authority, opposes Falstaff
- Archbishop of York: Rebel leader, opposes king
- Earl of Northumberland: Rebel noble, Hotspur's father
- Prince John: Hal's brother, loyal to king

play_title: The Life of King Henry V
content:
Play: The Life of King Henry V
Category: history
Year: 1599
Setting: England and France, early 15th century

Main Characters:
- King Henry V
- Chorus
- Duke of Exeter
- Fluellen
- Pistol
- Katherine
- Dauphin of France

Character Descriptions:
- King Henry V: King of England, leads Agincourt victory
- Chorus: Narrator, guides audience through story
- Duke of Exeter: Henry's uncle, loyal military advisor
- Fluellen: Welsh captain, enforces military discipline
- Pistol: Boastful soldier, Falstaff's former companion
- Katherine: French princess, marries Henry V
- Dauphin of France: French heir, opposes Henry

play_title: The Life of Henry the Eighth
content:
Play: The Life of Henry the Eighth
Category: history
Year: 1613
Setting: England, early 16th century

Main Characters:
- King Henry VIII
- Cardinal Wolsey
- Katherine of Aragon
- Anne Boleyn
- Thomas Cranmer
- Duke of Norfolk
- Duke of Buckingham

Character Descriptions:
- King Henry VIII: King of England, seeks divorce
- Cardinal Wolsey: Ambitious advisor, falls from power
- Katherine of Aragon: Henry's first wife, faces divorce
- Anne Boleyn: Henry's second wife, bears Elizabeth
- Thomas Cranmer: Archbishop, supports Henry's reforms
- Duke of Norfolk: Noble, opposes Wolsey's influence
- Duke of Buckingham: Noble, executed for treason

play_title: King Henry VI, the first part
content:
Play: King Henry VI, the first part
Category: history
Year: 1591-1592
Setting: England and France, 15th century

Main Characters:
- King Henry VI
- Joan of Arc
- Talbot
- Duke of Gloucester
- Cardinal Beaufort
- Margaret of Anjou
- Duke of York

Character Descriptions:
- King Henry VI: Young king of England, weak ruler
- Joan of Arc: French leader, inspires resistance
- Talbot: English general, fights for France
- Duke of Gloucester: Henry's uncle, protects crown
- Cardinal Beaufort: Ambitious cleric, rivals Gloucester
- Margaret of Anjou: French noble, marries Henry VI
- Duke of York: Noble, claims throne, stirs discord

play_title: King Henry VI, the second part
content:
Play: King Henry VI, the second part
Category: history
Year: 1590-1591
Setting: England, 15th century

Main Characters:
- King Henry VI
- Queen Margaret
- Duke of York
- Duke of Suffolk
- Jack Cade
- Humphrey, Duke of Gloucester
- Cardinal Beaufort

Character Descriptions:
- King Henry VI: Weak king, struggles with factions
- Queen Margaret: Henry's wife, seeks power
- Duke of York: Noble, claims throne, leads rebellion
- Duke of Suffolk: Margaret's ally, plots against Gloucester
- Jack Cade: Rebel leader, incites uprising
- Humphrey, Duke of Gloucester: Henry's uncle, targeted by rivals
- Cardinal Beaufort: Ambitious cleric, conspires against Gloucester

play_title: King Henry VI, the third part
content:
Play: King Henry VI, the third part
Category: history
Year: 1591-1592
Setting: England, 15th century

Main Characters:
- King Henry VI
- Queen Margaret
- Richard, Duke of York
- Edward IV
- Richard (later Richard III)
- Warwick
- Clarence

Character Descriptions:
- King Henry VI: Deposed king, seeks to reclaim throne
- Queen Margaret: Henry's wife, leads Lancaster forces
- Richard, Duke of York: Yorkist leader, claims crown
- Edward IV: Yorkist king, defeats Lancasters
- Richard (later Richard III): Yorkist, schemes for power
- Warwick: Noble, shifts allegiance, influences war
- Clarence: Edward's brother, betrays then rejoins York

Play: Julius Caesar
Category: tragedy
Year: 1599
Setting: Ancient Rome

Main Characters:
- Julius Caesar
- Brutus
- Cassius
- Mark Antony
- Octavius
- Calpurnia
- Portia

Character Descriptions:
- Julius Caesar: Roman dictator, assassinated by conspirators
- Brutus: Roman noble, leads conspiracy against Caesar
- Cassius: Conspirator, manipulates Brutus against Caesar
- Mark Antony: Caesar's ally, opposes conspirators
- Octavius: Caesar's heir, joins Antony
- Calpurnia: Caesar's wife, warns of danger
- Portia: Brutus's wife, seeks his confidence

Play: King John
Category: history
Year: 1595-1596
Setting: England and France, 13th century

Main Characters:
- King John
- Philip the Bastard
- Constance
- King Philip of France
- Prince Arthur
- Hubert
- Cardinal Pandulph

Character Descriptions:
- King John: King of England, faces rebellion
- Philip the Bastard: John's loyal illegitimate nephew
- Constance: Arthur's mother, seeks son's crown
- King Philip of France: French king, supports Arthur
- Prince Arthur: John's nephew, claims throne
- Hubert: John's servant, spares Arthur
- Cardinal Pandulph: Papal legate, stirs conflict

Play: The Tragedy of King Lear
Category: tragedy
Year: 1605-1606
Setting: Ancient Britain

Main Characters:
- King Lear
- Cordelia
- Goneril
- Regan
- Edmund
- Edgar
- Gloucester
- Kent
- Fool

Character Descriptions:
- King Lear: King of Britain, divides kingdom
- Cordelia: Lear's youngest daughter, disowned, loyal
- Goneril: Lear's eldest daughter, betrays him
- Regan: Lear's middle daughter, betrays him
- Edmund: Gloucester's illegitimate son, schemes power
- Edgar: Gloucester's legitimate son, disguises himself
- Gloucester: Earl, betrayed by Edmund
- Kent: Loyal nobleman, serves Lear in disguise
- Fool: Lear's jester, speaks truth

Play: Love's Labour's Lost
Category: comedy
Year: 1594-1595
Setting: Navarre, Spain

Main Characters:
- King of Navarre
- Princess of France
- Berowne
- Rosaline
- Longaville
- Maria
- Dumaine
- Katherine
- Don Armado

Character Descriptions:
- King of Navarre: King, vows to study, loves Princess
- Princess of France: French noble, courts Navarre
- Berowne: Lord, loves Rosaline, witty
- Rosaline: Princess's lady, loves Berowne
- Longaville: Lord, loves Maria
- Maria: Princess's lady, loves Longaville
- Dumaine: Lord, loves Katherine
- Katherine: Princess's lady, loves Dumaine
- Don Armado: Spanish noble, comically woos Jaquenetta

Play: Macbeth
Category: tragedy
Year: 1606
Setting: Scotland and England

Main Characters:
- Macbeth
- Lady Macbeth
- Three Witches
- Banquo
- Macduff
- Duncan
- Malcolm

Character Descriptions:
- Macbeth: Scottish general, usurps throne, becomes king
- Lady Macbeth: Macbeth's wife, drives his ambition
- Three Witches: Supernatural beings, prophesy Macbeth's fate
- Banquo: Macbeth's friend, general, later murdered
- Macduff: Scottish noble, avenges Duncan's murder
- Duncan: King of Scotland, murdered by Macbeth
- Malcolm: Duncan's son, rightful heir

Play: Measure for Measure
Category: comedy
Year: 1604
Setting: Vienna

Main Characters:
- Duke Vincentio
- Angelo
- Isabella
- Claudio
- Lucio
- Mariana
- Escalus

Character Descriptions:
- Duke Vincentio: Ruler of Vienna, disguises to observe
- Angelo: Deputy, enforces strict laws
- Isabella: Novice nun, pleads for Claudio
- Claudio: Isabella's brother, sentenced to death
- Lucio: Claudio's friend, spreads gossip
- Mariana: Angelo's former fiancée, aids plot
- Escalus: Wise advisor, serves Duke

Play: The Merchant of Venice
Category: comedy
Year: 1596-1597
Setting: Venice and Belmont, Italy

Main Characters:
- Antonio
- Shylock
- Portia
- Bassanio
- Jessica
- Lorenzo
- Gratiano
- Nerissa

Character Descriptions:
- Antonio: Venetian merchant, borrows from Shylock
- Shylock: Jewish moneylender, demands pound of flesh
- Portia: Heiress of Belmont, disguises as lawyer
- Bassanio: Portia's suitor, Antonio's friend
- Jessica: Shylock's daughter, elopes with Lorenzo
- Lorenzo: Jessica's lover, Bassanio's friend
- Gratiano: Bassanio's friend, loves Nerissa
- Nerissa: Portia's maid, marries Gratiano

Play: The Merry Wives of Windsor
Category: comedy
Year: 1597-1601
Setting: Windsor, England

Main Characters:
- Sir John Falstaff
- Mistress Ford
- Mistress Page
- Ford
- Page
- Anne Page
- Fenton
- Doctor Caius

Character Descriptions:
- Sir John Falstaff: Rogue, woos wives for money
- Mistress Ford: Wife, outwits Falstaff's advances
- Mistress Page: Wife, plots against Falstaff
- Ford: Mistress Ford's jealous husband
- Page: Mistress Page's husband, trusts wife
- Anne Page: Page's daughter, loves Fenton
- Fenton: Gentleman, marries Anne Page
- Doctor Caius: French suitor, competes for Anne

Play: A Midsummer Night's Dream
Category: comedy
Year: 1595-1596
Setting: Athens and nearby enchanted forest

Main Characters:
- Lysander
- Hermia
- Demetrius
- Helena
- Oberon
- Titania
- Puck
- Bottom
- Theseus
- Hippolyta

Character Descriptions:
- Lysander: Athenian lover, pursues Hermia
- Hermia: Athenian woman, loves Lysander
- Demetrius: Athenian man, initially loves Hermia
- Helena: Athenian woman, loves Demetrius
- Oberon: Fairy king, manipulates lovers
- Titania: Fairy queen, enchanted by Oberon
- Puck: Oberon's mischievous fairy servant
- Bottom: Weaver, transformed into donkey
- Theseus: Duke of Athens, marries Hippolyta
- Hippolyta: Amazon queen, Theseus's bride

Play: Much Ado About Nothing
Category: comedy
Year: 1598-1599
Setting: Messina, Sicily

Main Characters:
- Beatrice
- Benedick
- Claudio
- Hero
- Don Pedro
- Don John
- Leonato

Character Descriptions:
- Beatrice: Witty noblewoman, loves Benedick
- Benedick: Witty soldier, loves Beatrice
- Claudio: Young lord, loves Hero
- Hero: Leonato's daughter, loves Claudio
- Don Pedro: Prince, aids Claudio's courtship
- Don John: Pedro's brother, slanders Hero
- Leonato: Governor, Hero's father

Play: Othello, the Moor of Venice
Category: tragedy
Year: 1603-1604
Setting: Venice and Cyprus

Main Characters:
- Othello
- Desdemona
- Iago
- Cassio
- Emilia
- Roderigo
- Brabantio

Character Descriptions:
- Othello: Moorish general, marries Desdemona
- Desdemona: Othello's wife, Brabantio's daughter
- Iago: Othello's ensign, orchestrates deception
- Cassio: Othello's lieutenant, accused of affair
- Emilia: Iago's wife, Desdemona's attendant
- Roderigo: Desdemona's suitor, manipulated by Iago
- Brabantio: Desdemona's father, Venetian senator

Play: Pericles, Prince of Tyre
Category: history
Year: 1607-1608
Setting: Various Mediterranean locations

Main Characters:
- Pericles
- Marina
- Thaisa
- Gower
- Cleon
- Dionyza
- Lysimachus

Character Descriptions:
- Pericles: Prince of Tyre, seeks family
- Marina: Pericles's daughter, survives hardship
- Thaisa: Pericles's wife, presumed dead
- Gower: Narrator, guides play's story
- Cleon: Governor, raises Marina
- Dionyza: Cleon's wife, plots against Marina
- Lysimachus: Governor, loves Marina

Play: King Richard II
Category: history
Year: 1595
Setting: England, late 14th century

Main Characters:
- King Richard II
- Henry Bolingbroke
- John of Gaunt
- Duke of York
- Duchess of Gloucester
- Aumerle
- Mowbray

Character Descriptions:
- King Richard II: King of England, deposed
- Henry Bolingbroke: Rebel, becomes Henry IV
- John of Gaunt: Richard's uncle, loyal noble
- Duke of York: Richard's uncle, supports Bolingbroke
- Duchess of Gloucester: Widow, seeks justice
- Aumerle: York's son, loyal to Richard
- Mowbray: Noble, exiled for dispute

Play: King Richard III
Category: history
Year: 1592-1593
Setting: England, late 15th century

Main Characters:
- Richard III
- Duke of Buckingham
- Queen Margaret
- Lady Anne
- King Edward IV
- Clarence
- Richmond

Character Descriptions:
- Richard III: Scheming duke, becomes king
- Duke of Buckingham: Richard's ally, later betrayed
- Queen Margaret: Lancastrian widow, curses Richard
- Lady Anne: Widow, reluctantly marries Richard
- King Edward IV: Yorkist king, Richard's brother
- Clarence: Richard's brother, murdered by him
- Richmond: Rebel, becomes Henry VII

Play: Romeo and Juliet
Category: tragedy
Year: 1595-1596
Setting: Verona, Italy

Main Characters:
- Romeo Montague
- Juliet Capulet
- Mercutio
- Tybalt
- Friar Lawrence
- Nurse
- Benvolio
- Paris

Character Descriptions:
- Romeo Montague: Montague heir, loves Juliet
- Juliet Capulet: Capulet daughter, loves Romeo
- Mercutio: Romeo's friend, kinsman to Prince
- Tybalt: Juliet's cousin, aggressive Capulet
- Friar Lawrence: Priest, marries Romeo and Juliet
- Nurse: Juliet's caretaker, aids lovers
- Benvolio: Romeo's cousin, seeks peace
- Paris: Nobleman, seeks to marry Juliet

Play: The Taming of the Shrew
Category: comedy
Year: 1590-1592
Setting: Padua, Italy

Main Characters:
- Katherina
- Petruchio
- Bianca
- Lucentio
- Baptista
- Tranio
- Grumio

Character Descriptions:
- Katherina: Baptista's daughter, tamed by Petruchio
- Petruchio: Gentleman, marries Katherina for dowry
- Bianca: Katherina's sister, sought by suitors
- Lucentio: Gentleman, loves and marries Bianca
- Baptista: Wealthy father of Katherina, Bianca
- Tranio: Lucentio's servant, aids disguise
- Grumio: Petruchio's servant, comic assistant

Play: The Tempest
Category: comedy
Year: 1610-1611
Setting: A remote island

Main Characters:
- Prospero
- Miranda
- Ariel
- Caliban
- Ferdinand
- Alonso
- Antonio
- Sebastian
- Stephano
- Trinculo

Character Descriptions:
- Prospero: Exiled Duke of Milan, magician
- Miranda: Prospero's daughter, loves Ferdinand
- Ariel: Prospero's spirit servant, seeks freedom
- Caliban: Island native, Prospero's enslaved servant
- Ferdinand: Naples prince, loves Miranda
- Alonso: King of Naples, shipwrecked
- Antonio: Prospero's brother, usurped his dukedom
- Sebastian: Alonso's brother, plots against him
- Stephano: Drunken butler, plots with Caliban
- Trinculo: Jester, joins Stephano's plot

Play: The Two Gentlemen of Verona
Category: comedy
Year: 1590–1593
Setting: Verona and Milan, Italy

Main Characters:
- Valentine
- Proteus
- Julia
- Silvia
- Duke of Milan
- Lucetta
- Thurio
- Launce
- Speed

Character Descriptions:
- Valentine: Gentleman, loves Silvia
- Proteus: Gentleman, betrays Valentine, loves Silvia
- Julia: Proteus's lover, disguises as page
- Silvia: Duke's daughter, loves Valentine
- Duke of Milan: Silvia's father, plans her marriage
- Lucetta: Julia's maid, aids disguise
- Thurio: Silvia's suitor, Duke's choice
- Launce: Proteus's servant, comic figure
- Speed: Valentine's servant, witty assistant

play_title: The Life of Timon of Athens
content:
Play: The Life of Timon of Athens
Category: tragedy
Year: 1605-1608
Setting: Athens, Greece

Main Characters:
- Timon
- Apemantus
- Alcibiades
- Flavius
- Ventidius
- Lucius
- Sempronius

Character Descriptions:
- Timon: Wealthy Athenian, becomes misanthrope
- Apemantus: Cynical philosopher, criticizes society
- Alcibiades: General, rebels against Athens
- Flavius: Timon's loyal steward
- Ventidius: False friend, abandons Timon
- Lucius: False friend, rejects Timon
- Sempronius: False friend, betrays Timon

Play: The Tragedy of Titus Andronicus
Category: tragedy
Year: 1593-1594
Setting: Rome

Main Characters:
- Titus Andronicus
- Tamora
- Aaron
- Lavinia
- Saturninus
- Bassianus
- Lucius

Character Descriptions:
- Titus Andronicus: Roman general, seeks revenge
- Tamora: Goth queen, plots against Titus
- Aaron: Tamora's lover, orchestrates villainy
- Lavinia: Titus's daughter, brutally assaulted
- Saturninus: Roman emperor, marries Tamora
- Bassianus: Saturninus's brother, loves Lavinia
- Lucius: Titus's son, avenges family

Play: Troilus and Cressida
Category: tragedy
Year: 1601-1602
Setting: Troy and the Greek camp, during the Trojan War

Main Characters:
- Troilus
- Cressida
- Pandarus
- Hector
- Achilles
- Ulysses
- Diomedes

Character Descriptions:
- Troilus: Trojan prince, loves Cressida
- Cressida: Trojan woman, betrays Troilus
- Pandarus: Cressida's uncle, facilitates romance
- Hector: Trojan warrior, killed by Achilles
- Achilles: Greek warrior, kills Hector
- Ulysses: Greek leader, manipulates Achilles
- Diomedes: Greek warrior, wins Cressida

metadata.setting: Troy and the Greek camp, during the Trojan War

play_title: Twelfth Night; Or, What You Will
content:
Play: Twelfth Night; Or, What You Will
Category: comedy
Year: 1601-1602
Setting: Illyria, an ancient region on the Adriatic Sea

Main Characters:
- Viola
- Sebastian
- Orsino
- Olivia
- Malvolio
- Sir Toby Belch
- Sir Andrew Aguecheek
- Maria
- Feste

Character Descriptions:
- Viola: Shipwrecked woman, disguises as Cesario
- Sebastian: Viola's twin brother, presumed dead
- Orsino: Duke of Illyria, loves Olivia
- Olivia: Countess, loves Cesario, then Sebastian
- Malvolio: Olivia's steward, humiliated by prank
- Sir Toby Belch: Olivia's drunken uncle, plots prank
- Sir Andrew Aguecheek: Toby's foolish friend, courts Olivia
- Maria: Olivia's maid, orchestrates Malvolio prank
- Feste: Olivia's witty fool, sings and jests

metadata.setting: Illyria, an ancient region on the Adriatic Sea

content:
Play: The Winter's Tale
Category: comedy
Year: 1610-1611
Setting: Sicilia and Bohemia

Main Characters:
- Leontes
- Hermione
- Perdita
- Polixenes
- Camillo
- Paulina
- Autolycus
- Florizel

Character Descriptions:
- Leontes: King of Sicilia, jealous husband
- Hermione: Leontes's wife, falsely accused
- Perdita: Leontes's daughter, raised in Bohemia
- Polixenes: King of Bohemia, Leontes's friend
- Camillo: Loyal advisor, serves both kings
- Paulina: Hermione's friend, seeks justice
- Autolycus: Rogue, aids Bohemia's comedy
- Florizel: Polixenes's son, loves Perdita
